text: CASIS' Emily White blogs for @NASA, Experiencing the First Annual ISS Research and Development Conference. #ISS http://t.co/UefA8g7a
Nelson thanks panel for a "most informative" session and adjourns.  Thanks to all for following our live Tweets! #ISShearing
Reiter agrees with @astro_Pettit on importance of education through the ISS. Mentions SPHERES student competition. #ISShearing
@astro_Pettit says it would break his heart if we had to tell students we could no longer fly astronauts. #ISShearing
Nelson asks @astro_Pettit and Reiter what we can do to increase awareness. Petit says student outreach is key. #ISShearing
@astro_Pettit important to have new instruments that can collect data on the Station.  Secondary benefits for remote healthcare. #ISShearing
Royston: Developing new on-orbit systems to collect data without waiting for samples to be returned to ground. #ISShearing
Royston: Working with NASA payloads team every day to improve processes. We manage NASA interface for new researchers. #ISShearing
Nelson asks Royston what @ISSCASIS is doing to reduce integration time. #ISShearing
Gerstenmaier talks space debris with Sen. Nelson. Class of objects larger than shielding, but too small to track is risk. #ISShearing
Royston: Protein crystal research goal is to settle fundamental questions and enable commercial development. #ISShearing
@astro_Pettit says crew observations important because of serendipity. They can see things detectors won't look for. #ISShearing
Gerstenmaier: ISS is great platform for technology testbeds before full-scale, full-cost deployment. #ISShearing
Gerstenmaier: We need to prove the systems and get more successful research under our belt. #ISShearing
Gerstenmaier: We are looking at technical life limiting factors. From physical standpoint, can probably go to 2028. #ISShearing
Hutchison asks Gerstenmaier about ISS extension past 2020 and importance of Earth observation. #ISShearing
Royston: We are driven by goal of bringng the best benefits back to Earth as quickly as possible, building on known science. #ISShearing
@astro_Pettit excited by the thrill of the unknown. Retinal wrinkles in crew are a new problem to solve. #ISShearing
Sen. Boozman asks the panel what excites them the most. #ISShearing
Gerstenmaier answers Sen. Boozman that we have good cargo launch capability. Need to bring comm'l crew capability online. #ISShearing
Gerstenmaier: Tough to predict breakthroughs, new industries. Have to look where the gravity vector is important. #ISShearing
Reiter: If we only look at direct tangible benefits, we miss the benefits of gaining knowledge for its own sake and education. #ISShearing
Royston: We're looking at opportunities in muscle wasting, osteoporosis, materials science, space tech, and Earth observation. #ISShearing
@astro_Pettit answers that the ISS offers us the ability to dig deeper into fundamental physical processes, free from gravity. #ISShearing
Sen. Rubio wants to know what advances are coming from space to justify our expenditures on ISS. #ISShearing
Royston: @ISSCASIS has the capability to use Science Collegium to establish baseline for new research, particularly biotech. #ISShearing
Gerstenmaier: We have not done enough research in cancer to be certain of space research benefits. #ISShearing
Gerstenmaier: Both applied and basic research on vaccines look promising. Use space to "spark creativity" and produce on ground. #ISShearing
Gerstenmaier: We have learned that mutations increase in space and which genes affect virulence in salmonella. #ISShearing
Reiter: Looking to future, turn-around time for science could be improved. We could also use smaller lab facilities more. #ISShearing
Reiter: It may be too early to tell how to use the ISS in a optimum way because we are still moving from construction phase. #ISShearing
@astro_Pettit compares working on ISS to expeditions to Antarctica. Work 13-14 hrs a day, but only 6 hours for science. #ISShearing
@astro_Pettit says the prime limiting factor is crewtime. He notes that working in "harsh frontier" limits time for science. #ISShearing
Hutchison asks @astro_Pettit and Reiter for specific suggestions on expanding ISS research capabilities. #ISShearing
Royston: Permanent Board of Directors will soon be announced and exceed everyone's expectations. #ISShearing
Royston: We are working with industry partners to establish commercial research projects that will fill the cargo missions. #ISShearing
Royston: We have a world-class panel of scientists who established initial research pathways. #ISShearing
James Royston explains that our mission is to maximize the use of the ISS National Lab through independent management. #ISShearing
Reiter: Collaboration between @ESA and @NASA on ISS will help us take next steps in exploration. #ISShearing
Reiter: Beyond science and technology developments, astronauts on the ISS provide a global platform for education. #ISShearing
Reiter: Europe's participation on ISS has given thousands the opportunity to work on the frontiers of science and exploration. #ISShearing
Thomas Reiter from @esa discusses the importance of international collaboration and shared capabilities on the ISS. #ISShearing
Gerstenmaier is excited about the @YouTube Space Lab experiments designed by students and that will be done by Suni Williams #ISShearing
Gerstenmaier: There has never been a platform like this before. We could see the start of a space economy on the ISS. #ISShearing
@NASA's Bill Gerstenmaier wants us to understand both the long-term impacts and the progress we make every day on the ISS. #ISShearing
@astro_Pettit says observations and discoveries in space will enhance technology, culture, and society. #ISShearing
@astro_Pettit talks about the importance of pushing back frontiers. "The answers are not in the back of the book." #ISShearing
@astro_Pettit now testifying about his experiences in space. #ISShearing
Nelson discussing potential for ISS as a waystation for future exploration missions and new stations further out. #ISShearing
Sen. Nelson reminds audience that ISS has been continually occupied since Expedition 1 in 2000.  Expects to continue past 2020. #ISShearing
Sen. Hutchison cites @AMSISS as example of great fundamental science we can do on the ISS. #ISShearing
Sen. Hutchison: ISS is open to anyone who needs to do research that can only be done in space. #ISShearing
Sen. Hutchison emphasizing need to continue research and "reach for the stars" as Sally Ride did. #ISShearing
Sen. Nelson eager to hear from @astro_pettit about his real-life experiences on the ISS National Laboratory. #ISShearing
Sen. Nelson says this hearing is to help the American public understand the amazing platform we have in space with the ISS. #ISShearing
Watch this morning's hearing on ISS utilization w/ the Senate Commerce Committee. Interim ED Jim Royston to testify. http://t.co/u1q4hicd
@ISSCASIS Farewell to Dr. Sally Ride. http://t.co/2l7VZhcD
